comments.html: Related to the first point about point-to-point sessions in TCP, I would also add that OSPF neighbor discovery (via broadcast of Hello messages) is impossible to be implemented over TCP. You might replace IP multicast for multiple individual TCP sessions to disseminate LSA information (your first point), but you cannot implement neighbor discovery using TCP, because you need to know the other endpoint in order to establish the TCP connection.
comments.name: Enrique Vallejo
